column1: General instructions here include how to complete each field in both "tabs".
column2: These are submitted as a complete set of assertions (a vocabulary, also called SAB or source abbreviation) in two TSV files (nodes.tsv and edges.tsv).
column3: One DCC will likely want to submit multiple vocabularies.
column4: The other two tabs here show examples
column5: Required titles and required value descriptions are bolded.

column1: This is the unique code in the submitted vocabulary. It accepts generally IRIs (e.g. purl) or SAB<space>CODE which is preferred (required).
column2: This is the SAB (optional - if can't be easily determined from node_id)
column5: These are text synonyms (optional) separated by vertical bars.
column6: These are external references which are used as much as possible and in same format as node_id (optional)
column7: This is a numeric decimal value (optional).
column8: This is a numeric decimal value (optional).
column9: This is a numeric decimal value (optional).
column10: This is units (optional and NOT referenced to standard vocabulary).

column1: This is in form of node_id and must exist in submitted nodes file or already existing node in KG ingestion (required).
column2: This is a string or a IRI of a Relation Ontology relationship type (required). For subClass "isa" is used.
column3: This is in form of node_id and must exist in submitted nodes file or already existing node in KG ingestion (required).
column4: This is an optionsl string specific to an SAB to classify evidence with custom nominal values (optional).
